content.raw: In this case, I think we can switch gazebo to `Get<ignition::math::Color>`, but we should keep an eye out for other failed `Get<obj>` calls. Thanks!
content.html: In this case, I think we can switch gazebo to Get<ignition::math::Color>, but we should keep an eye out for other failed Get<obj> calls. Thanks!

content.raw:
Oh, you make an excellent point.  I did remove some of the lexical_casts down in sdformat, so that very well may be the problem.

So it seems like we either need to re-enable the lexical_casts down in sdformat, change the boost::variant in sdformat so that it accepts gazebo::common::Color, or change gazebo so it uses ignition::math::Color.  I think any of those will fix it.  Thoughts?
content.html:
Oh, you make an excellent point. I did remove some of the lexical_casts down in sdformat, so that very well may be the problem.

So it seems like we either need to re-enable the lexical_casts down in sdformat, change the boost::variant in sdformat so that it accepts gazebo::common::Color, or change gazebo so it uses ignition::math::Color. I think any of those will fix it. Thoughts?

pull_request.title: try finding both sdformat 5 and 6 until we switch to 6

pullrequest.title: try finding both sdformat 5 and 6 until we switch to 6

content.raw: That makes sense, but something must have changed, because the `gazebo::common::Color` surely wasn't explicitly recognized by sdformat in earlier versions. Maybe `boost::lexical_cast` was enabling those conversions into unrecognized class types?
content.html: That makes sense, but something must have changed, because the gazebo::common::Color surely wasn't explicitly recognized by sdformat in earlier versions. Maybe boost::lexical_cast was enabling those conversions into unrecognized class types?

pull_request.title: try finding both sdformat 5 and 6 until we switch to 6

pullrequest.title: try finding both sdformat 5 and 6 until we switch to 6

content.raw:
This is a bit of a guess, but in the latest sdformat code, the boost::variant looks like this:

```
    public: typedef boost::variant<bool, char, std::string, int, uint64_t,
                                   unsigned int, double, float, sdf::Time,
                                   ignition::math::Color,
                                   ignition::math::Vector2i,
                                   ignition::math::Vector2d,
                                   ignition::math::Vector3d,
                                   ignition::math::Quaterniond,
                                   ignition::math::Pose3d> ParamVariant;
```

However, if you look at that line from Visual.cc:487, it is trying to access the variant with the template type of common::Color.  That mismatch may be what is triggering the build error.
content.html:
This is a bit of a guess, but in the latest sdformat code, the boost::variant looks like this:

    public: typedef boost::variant<bool, char, std::string, int, uint64_t,
                                   unsigned int, double, float, sdf::Time,
                                   ignition::math::Color,
                                   ignition::math::Vector2i,
                                   ignition::math::Vector2d,
                                   ignition::math::Vector3d,
                                   ignition::math::Quaterniond,
                                   ignition::math::Pose3d> ParamVariant;

However, if you look at that line from Visual.cc:487, it is trying to access the variant with the template type of common::Color. That mismatch may be what is triggering the build error.

content.html: to clarify, I'm not asking you to fix this Chris, just asking if you have any ideas about what may be the problem

content.raw:
I'll cc @clalancette about the gazebo build failures with sdf 6, with one failure from [Visual.cc:487](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a2e24ead6b45c637436c5f38b906c5d327e4f6b1/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Visual.cc-487), in which an `sdf::Element` is calling `Get<gazebo::common::Color>` and leads to a failure.

Any ideas Chris?
content.html:
I'll cc @clalancette about the gazebo build failures with sdf 6, with one failure from Visual.cc:487, in which an sdf::Element is calling Get<gazebo::common::Color> and leads to a failure.

Any ideas Chris?

content.raw:
With SDF 6 installed, cmake would configure, but I would see this warning: 

~~~
CMake Warning at cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake:585 (find_package):
  Could not find a configuration file for package "SDFormat" that is
  compatible with requested version "5.0.0".

  The following configuration files were considered but not accepted:

    /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake, version: 6.0.0
    /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake, version: 6.0.0
~~~

Branch [find_sdf6_louise](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/6735bf79b363da7b0989325b2a807abfb9e178f5?at=find_sdf6_louise) has a proposed fix, feel free to merge if you agree.

Note that Gazebo default is not building against SDF 6:

~~~
In file included from /usr/include/boost/bind/arg.hpp:24:0,
                 from /usr/include/boost/bind/bind.hpp:29,
                 from /usr/include/boost/bind.hpp:22,
                 from /home/louise/code/gazeboA/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:17:
/usr/include/boost/variant/get.hpp: In instantiation of ‘typename boost::add_reference<T>::type boost::strict_get(boost::variant<T0, TN ...>&) [with U = gazebo::common::Color; T0 = bool; TN = {char, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, int, long unsigned int, unsigned int, double, float, sdf::Time, ignition::math::Color, ignition::math::Vector2<int>, ignition::math::Vector2<double>, ignition::math::Vector3<double>, ignition::math::Quaternion<double>, ignition::math::Pose3<double>}; typename boost::add_reference<T>::type = gazebo::common::Color&]’:
/usr/include/boost/variant/get.hpp:284:25:   required from ‘typename boost::add_reference<T>::type boost::get(boost::variant<T0, TN ...>&) [with U = gazebo::common::Color; T0 = bool; TN = {char, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, int, long unsigned int, unsigned int, double, float, sdf::Time, ignition::math::Color, ignition::math::Vector2<int>, ignition::math::Vector2<double>, ignition::math::Vector3<double>, ignition::math::Quaternion<double>, ignition::math::Pose3<double>}; typename boost::add_reference<T>::type = gazebo::common::Color&]’
/usr/include/sdformat-6.0/sdf/Param.hh:291:31:   required from ‘bool sdf::Param::Get(T&) const [with T = gazebo::common::Color]’
/usr/include/sdformat-6.0/sdf/Element.hh:454:7:   required from ‘std::pair<T, bool> sdf::Element::Get(const string&, const T&) const [with T = gazebo::common::Color; std::__cxx11::string = std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>]’
/usr/include/sdformat-6.0/sdf/Element.hh:429:55:   required from ‘T sdf::Element::Get(const string&) const [with T = gazebo::common::Color; std::__cxx11::string = std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>]’
/home/louise/code/gazeboA/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:487:66:   required from here
/usr/include/boost/variant/get.hpp:212:5: error: static assertion failed: boost::variant does not contain specified type U, call to boost::get<U>(boost::variant<T...>&) will always throw boost::bad_get exception
     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT_MSG(
     ^
gazebo/rendering/CMakeFiles/gazebo_rendering.dir/build.make:1142: recipe for target 'gazebo/rendering/CMakeFiles/gazebo_rendering.dir/Visual.cc.o' failed
make[2]: *** [gazebo/rendering/CMakeFiles/gazebo_rendering.dir/Visual.cc.o] Error 1
~~~
content.html:
With SDF 6 installed, cmake would configure, but I would see this warning: 

CMake Warning at cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake:585 (find_package):
  Could not find a configuration file for package "SDFormat" that is
  compatible with requested version "5.0.0".

  The following configuration files were considered but not accepted:

    /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake, version: 6.0.0
    /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake, version: 6.0.0

Branch find_sdf6_louise has a proposed fix, feel free to merge if you agree.

Note that Gazebo default is not building against SDF 6:

content.raw: in theory, we could support more than two versions, so the `MAX_VERSION` doesn't handle that case. I think this will be temporary anyway, so I don't want to overengineer the logic
content.html: in theory, we could support more than two versions, so the MAX_VERSION doesn't handle that case. I think this will be temporary anyway, so I don't want to overengineer the logic
